meanings.definition: A person or thing that throbs.
meanings.sent1: The engine in the old car was one of the throbbers that made the whole vehicle shake.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed to the monitor, showing the patient the throbbers in their heartbeat.
meanings.sent3: The throbbers in the dance floor lights seemed to pulse in time with the music.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the throbbers of thunder grew louder and more intense.
meanings.sent5: The throbbers of excitement in the crowd could be felt throughout the stadium.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic collected all the throbbers from the engine to inspect them closely.
meanings.sent2: In the museum, there was a display of various throbbers used in different historical machines.
meanings.sent3: The throbbers on the shelf rattled as the cat tried to climb up.
meanings.sent4: The throbbers of the clock echoed through the empty house, marking each passing hour.
meanings.sent5: The throbbers of the drums reverberated through the concert hall, captivating the audience.
